title: Officer-involved shooting in east Colorado Springs
content:
COLORADO SPRINGS, Colo. (KKTV) - An officer-involved shooting is under investigation in east Colorado Springs.
A 16-year-old suspect was been taken to the hospital with serious injuries. As of Friday he was still undergoing treatment. The suspect was wanted for 2nd-degree assault with a weapon, felony menacing, 2nd-degree burglary and various counts of felony theft. The unidentified juvenile was armed at the time of the shooting according to police.
No officers were injured in the incident.
Colorado Springs Police confirmed the shooting happened at the Pine Creek Village Apartments in the 800 block of Chapman Dr. near S. Academy Blvd and E. Fountain Blvd. at about 3 p.m.
Officers established surveillance in the area prior to the encounter to execute a warrant.
The El Paso County Sheriff's Office has now taken over the investigation.
